projects.title: Bebot
projects.about: Bebot is a Discord music bot that started as a personal project for my friends and me. Over the years, it has evolved through feedback and new ideas, making it a constant work in progress that I actively improve.
projects.lessonsLearned: Through Bebot, I’ve sharpened my Python skills and gained hands-on experience with async programming using Asyncio. I also learned the ins and outs of Discord’s API and how to interact with it using discord.py.

projects.title: Portfolio
projects.about: I built this portfolio website to showcase my work in a clean and simple way. I wanted something lightweight but dynamic, so I used Go for the backend, HTMX for interactivity, and TailwindCSS for styling.
projects.lessonsLearned: This project was a great chance to dive deeper into Go and experiment with HTMX for dynamic content, Templ for reusable HTML, and Gin as a web framework. It reinforced my appreciation for efficient, minimalistic web development.

projects.title: CarpinchoMQ
projects.about: CarpinchoMQ is a distributed message broker built in Elixir as part of a university project on concurrent systems. It uses Horde for distributed process management and includes a React-based UI and a simple JavaScript library for network interaction.
projects.lessonsLearned: This project gave me hands-on experience with Elixir’s concurrency model and the challenges of building distributed systems. It also led me to my first open-source contribution, improving the desing of one of Horde's components: Pull Request.

projects.title: GeoQuest
projects.about: GeoQuest is an AR treasure hunt game developed as a university team project. Players follow clues using their phones to bring objects to life, making it perfect for museums and galleries looking to enhance visitor experiences. It also included a QR validation app for redeeming in-game rewards.
projects.lessonsLearned: This was my first large-scale React Native project, where I explored AR in creative ways. While we achieved our goal, I learned how crucial it is to carefully choose technologies and scope. We relied too much on ViroReact, which led to setbacks, but thanks to community support, we delivered a solid MVP.
